alert.note: Alert for Central Mountains; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 3:42PM MST until January 01 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM WEDNESDAY TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet with locally higher amounts possible. * WHERE...Wasatch Mountains I-80 North, Wasatch Mountains South of I-80, Western Uinta Mountains, Wasatch Plateau/Book Cliffs and Central Mountains. * WHEN...From 3 PM Wednesday to 5 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow Wednesday afternoon through early Thursday morning will focus across areas favored in southwest flow such as the northern Wasatch and Bear River Mountains as well as Provo Canyon. By late Thursday night through Friday night, the heaviest snow will be across the upper Cottonwoods and central Utah mountains.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
